unnormalised: ## Quora Post: Rental Yields - Let's talk real estate, shall we? (Real Estate & Property)
normalised: ## Quora Post: Rental Yields - Let's talk real estate, shall we? (Real Estate and Property)

unnormalised: Been digging into rental yields lately, and thought I'd share some thoughts, especially for those of us looking at Indian real estate. Rental yield, simply put, is the return you get on your investment as a landlord – expressed as a percentage of the property's value. Basically, how much biryani can you afford from your rental income, haha!
normalised: Been digging into rental yields lately, and thought I would share some thoughts, especially for those of us looking at Indian real estate. Rental yield, simply put, is the return you get on your investment as a landlord – expressed as a percentage of the property's value. Basically, how much biryani can you afford from your rental income, ha ha!

unnormalised: Think of it this way: you buy a flat in, say, Bangalore for Rs. 50 Lakh. If you rent it out for Rs. 15,000 per month (Rs. 1,80,000 annually), your gross rental yield is (1,80,000 / 50,00,000) * 100 = 3.6%.
normalised: Think of it this way: you buy a flat in, say, Bangalore for rupee fifty lakh. If you rent it out for rupee fifteen thousand per month (rupee one lakh eighty thousand annually), your gross rental yield is (one lakh eighty thousand divided by fifty lakh) multiplied by one hundred equals three point six percent.

unnormalised: Now, yields in India can vary wildly. A plush apartment in Mumbai might command a premium price, but the rental income might not keep pace, leading to lower yields. Places like Coimbatore or Jaipur might offer better opportunities due to lower property values.
normalised: Now, yields in India can vary wildly. A plush apartment in Mumbai might command a premium price, but the rental income might not keep pace, leading to lower yields. Places like Coimbatore or Jaipur might offer better opportunities due to lower property values.

unnormalised: Remember to factor in expenses! Maintenance charges, property taxes (nagarpalika walas!), agent commissions, and potential vacancy periods all eat into that gross yield. Always calculate your NET rental yield for a realistic picture.
normalised: Remember to factor in expenses! Maintenance charges, property taxes (nagarpalika walas!), agent commissions, and potential vacancy periods all eat into that gross yield. Always calculate your N E T rental yield for a realistic picture.

unnormalised: Also, consider the location. A property near a major IT hub in Gurgaon or a well-connected metro station can attract higher rents.
normalised: Also, consider the location. A property near a major I T hub in Gurgaon or a well-connected metro station can attract higher rents.

unnormalised: During Onam, my Malayali friends from Kochi always emphasize good investments for the future. So, take your time, do your research, and understand the rental yield potential before diving into a property. Happy investing!
